org.block.project.block.assists

Interface BlockList.Single<T extends Block>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BlockList<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>
    Enclosing interface:
    BlockList<T extends Block>

    public static interface BlockList.Single<T extends Block>
extends BlockList<T>
    If the block is guaranteed to have only one attachment then the block should implement this instead of AttachableBlock.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.block.project.block.assists.BlockList

        BlockList.Single<T extends Block>

        @Deprecated
default int getMaxAttachments()
        Deprecated. The only possible answer is 1, therefore if known it shouldn't need to be checked
        Gets the max amount of attachments that this block may have. If unlimited attachments then it would return Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Specified by:
        getMaxAttachments in interface BlockList<T extends Block>
        Returns:
        The max amount of attachments this block can accept. This number will always be positive
